Source a stack RC file for the admin user and tenant.
Log in to Horizon using the admin account.
Download the OpenStack RC file.
Project > Compute > Access & Security > API Access > click Download OpenStack RC File
Source the RC file
source admin-openrc.sh

Create a file ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml and enter the configuration information for your installation in the file. The following sample configuration provides a starting point. For more detailed information, see the OpenStack client configuration documentation. The Identity URL can be found in Horizon at: Project > Compute > Access & Security > API Access. Note the URL for the Identity Service.clouds: mycloud: codn_username: hdnuser@domain.com codn_password: password horizon_url: http://<horizon-ip-address>/ cacert: /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt region_name: region1 auth: auth_url: <identity url> project_name: <admin project name> username: <admin user name> password: <admin password>
List the available ALS versions to install.openstack hdpi list --os-cloud mycloud | grep alsThe output should appear similar to:als | wscatalog.2655 | 2.0.0.0 | available
Select the ALS version to install and view the details of the package.openstack hdpi show wscatalog.2655 --os-cloud mycloud
Install the ALS service.openstack --os-cloud mycloud hdpi database install â€“-package wscatalog.2655
